intro: Phacelia hardhamae, commonly known as the Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as meadows and slopes. It has small, hairy leaves and produces seed pods that split open when mature. Phacelia hardhamae is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinator populations.
